definition: to part company/to split up/to break up

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
"break-up agent", person who acts for sb who wishes to terminate a relationship but does not have the heart to do so

sentences.english: They had an argument and split-up.
Soft but safe Yin Shi Zu, never mind to break up with him.
sentences.chinese: 石柔只求尹祖平安无恙，绝不介意与他分手。

sentences.english: The parents after parting company for placatory I, give me more love respectively.
sentences.chinese: 分手后的父母为了抚慰我，分别给予我更多的爱。

sentences.english: She's sobbing because her boyfriend broke up with her.
sentences.chinese: 她正抽抽噎噎地哭泣，因为男友和她分手了。

sentences.english: Breaking up can stop us from quarrelling.
sentences.chinese: 分手才能停止我们之间的争吵。

sentences.english: Let's say your colleague at work has just been broken up with, by her boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 假设你有个公司的同事刚刚和她的男友分手。

sentences.english: When that day comes to you, the broke up that you have been through just was a piece of cake.
sentences.chinese: 当那一天到来，你所经历的分手只不过是小事一桩。

sentences.english: I kissed Will the night before he left and broke up with Ethan soon after.
sentences.chinese: 分别的那天晚上，我问了威尔，不久就跟伊桑分手了。

sentences.english: Frank began to panic as it dawned on him that they might be over.
sentences.chinese: 当弗兰克渐渐明白两人可能分手的时候，他开始发慌。

sentences.english: In 1893, Henry Ziegland ended a relationship with his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 1893年亨利希格兰与其女友分手了。

sentences.english: This time, though, the Lakers will be without their second-leading scorer and rebounder .
sentences.chinese: 可是这次湖人缺少了他们的二号得分手和篮板手。

sentences.english: I want us to break up.
I don't understand why Wang Lei broke up with me?
sentences.chinese: 我想不通为什么王磊要和我分手？

sentences.english: Say nothing of, how old are who didn't break-up.
sentences.chinese: 说真的没有什么的，都几岁了谁没分手过。

sentences.english: Honor he feared injuries, again more encouraged separated, reluctantly he heaped chasing again.
sentences.chinese: 荣恐玥再受伤害，忍痛提出分手，更鼓励浚再追玥。

definition: to do the splits (gymnastics)/(Tw) two-timing (in romantic relationships)/Taiwan pr. [pi1 tui3]
(romantic) love/CL:個|个[ge4],場|场[chang3]/in love/to have an affair
to part without hard feelings (idiom)/to cut the knot as smoothly as you tied it
to court/to go steady/to be dating
to quarrel/to have a row/quarrel/CL:頓|顿[dun4]
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
